NF-kappa B is a nuclear protein of the rel oncogene family capable of enhancing transcription of several cellular genes , including <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the IL-2 receptor , and viral genes transcribed from the HIV-1 LTR .

text: It has been reported that <extra_id_0> HIV-1 protease <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may cleave the NF-kappa B precursor to its active form in vitro .

In this study the effects of <extra_id_0> HIV protease <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on NF-kappa B precursor activation were examined in Jurkat T cells by introducing a protease expression vector into the cells .

text: Increased NF-kappa B activity was observed and this increased activity was blocked by a specific inhibitor of the viral protease .

Viral transcription , as measured using LTR - <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> assays , was only slightly enhanced in the <extra_id_0> HIV-protease <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expressing cells , while secretion of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and expression of the IL-2 receptor were not affected .

text: The limited activation of NF-kappa B by <extra_id_0> HIV protease <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> appears unlikely to have a significant effect on virus expression or T cell function .
